publication.abstract: © 2015 The Author.Motivation: Pseudouridine (Ψ), catalyzed by pseudouridine synthase (PUS), is the most abundant RNA modification and has important cellular functions. Developing an algorithm to identify Ψ sites is an important work. And it is better if the algorithm could assign which PUS modifies the Ψ sites. Here, we developed PPUS (http://lyh.pkmu.cn/ppus/), the first web server to predict PUS-specific Ψ sites. PPUS employed support vector machine as the classifier and used nucleotides around Ψ sites as the features. Currently, PPUS could accurately predict new Ψ sites for PUS1, PUS4 and PUS7 in yeast and PUS4 in human. PPUS is well designed and friendly to user.
publication.title: PPUS: A web server to predict PUS-specific pseudouridine sites

summary.description: Online tool to predict pseudouridine sites recognized by pseudouridine synthase in RNA.
summary.name: PPUS
